description: Owners can spend up to $40,000 on a dog’s medical care, especially if surgery is required. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Want a dog? Be prepared to set aside over $100k
title_page: Want a dog? Be prepared to set aside over $100k | The Straits Times
maintext:
SINGAPORE - My partner’s two-year-old cocker spaniel Popcorn was recently diagnosed with hip dysplasia, a degenerative joint disease where the ball and socket of the hip joint grind against each other because they do not fit properly.
Popcorn got started on physiotherapy once every fortnight, which costs about $120 per session.
